metadata.title: CVE-2019-12360 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A stack-based buffer over-read exists in FoFiTrueType::dumpString infofi/FoFiTrueType.cc in Xpdf 4.01.01. It can, for example, be triggered bysending crafted TrueType data in a PDF document to the pdftops tool. Itmight allow an attacker to cause Denial of Service or leak memory data intodump content.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12360` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: poppler package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.13').
texlive-bin package in xenial is affected, but a decision has been made to defer addressing it.
emscripten: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
